Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Fisheries and Oceans, pursuant to section 43a of the Fisheries Act, hereby makes the annexed Pacific Fishery Management Area Regulations, 2007.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Fishing Zone has the same meaning as in the Oceans Act. (zone de pêche)

management area or Area means a division of Canadian fisheries waters as enumerated and described in Schedule 2 and includes the portion of any stream that flows into that division and that is seaward of the mean high water mark near the mouth of that stream. (secteur or secteur d’exploitation)
shoreline means the apparent high water mark. (rivage)
Subarea means a subdivision of a management area. (sous-secteur)
surfline means the lines described in Schedule 1. (ligne de démarcation)

Section.Text: All geographical co-ordinates referenced in the schedules are provided in the North American Datum 83 (NAD 83) geodetic system.
All lines joining the geographical co-ordinates of points described in the schedules are interpreted as rhumb lines.
These Regulations apply to the Canadian fisheries waters of the Pacific Ocean.
The areas in the Canadian fisheries waters of the Pacific Ocean described in Schedule 2 are hereby prescribed as management areas.
These Regulations come into force on the day on which they are registered.
